privacy_page.title: Privacy Policy - CronPost
privacy_page.content:
1. Introduction

Welcome to CronPost ("we," "us," or "our"). We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our service (the "Service").

By using CronPost, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this Policy. Your trust is important to us, and we strive to be transparent in how we handle your data.

2. Information We Collect

We collect information solely for the purpose of operating and improving the Service. We do not sell, rent, or use your data for unrelated purposes.

2.1. Information You Provide to Us

  • Account Information: When you register, we collect your email address and a hashed version of your password. We do not store your plain text password under any circumstances.
  • Scheduled Messages: We store the content of the messages you create, the recipient details (e.g., email addresses, phone numbers), and your defined delivery schedule. All message content is treated as strictly confidential and accessible only by automated systems for message dispatch.
  • Check-in Configuration: We retain your check-in preferences and related settings necessary for determining message dispatch conditions.

2.2. Information from Third-Party Services

  • Google Sign-In: If you register or log in using Google, we may receive your name, email address, and profile picture from your Google account. This data is used solely for account creation and authentication.

2.3. Usage Data (Log Data)

We collect minimal technical data such as IP addresses, access timestamps, and browser/device information for security, debugging, and service quality assurance. This data is never used for behavioral profiling or advertising.

3. How We Use Your Information

We use your information strictly to operate and enhance the Service. This includes:

  • Creating and maintaining your CronPost account.
  • Enabling message creation, scheduling, and delivery.
  • Monitoring your check-in status as per your configuration.
  • Delivering scheduled messages when inactivity thresholds are met.
  • Sending necessary notifications, including check-in reminders and status alerts.
  • Ensuring the security and reliability of the Service.

We will never access, view, or use the contents of your messages or recipient data for any purpose other than automated delivery. We do not use your information for advertising or analytics unrelated to service functionality.

4. How We Share Your Information

We are committed to limiting the sharing of your personal data. Your information may be shared only with:

  • Service Providers: We rely on trusted vendors to provide essential services, including:
    • Cloud Hosting: For secure storage and processing of your data.
    • Payment Processing: To handle subscription payments securely.
    • Network Services: For DNS resolution, DDoS protection, and performance optimization.
    • Email Delivery: To send verification, notification, and scheduled messages from noreply@cronpost.com.
    These providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and may only use it for service delivery on our behalf.
  • Legal Requirements: We may disclose your information when required by law or in response to valid legal requests. Where legally permitted, we will notify you of such requests.
  • No Sale of Data: We do not sell, rent, or license your data to any third party.
  • No Marketing Sharing: We do not share your personal data or message content with third parties for marketing purposes.

5. Security of Your Information

We implement robust technical and organizational measures to protect your data against unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction. These include:

  • Data encryption in transit (SSL/TLS) and at rest.
  • Secure backend infrastructure (e.g., Supabase, PostgreSQL, encrypted storage).
  • Password hashing using modern cryptographic standards.
  • Use of CAPTCHA (Cloudflare Turnstile) to prevent abuse and bot attacks.

Please note that no system can be 100% secure. While we follow best practices, we cannot guarantee absolute data security.

6. Data Retention

We retain your personal data only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this Policy, or as required by law. Specifically:

  • Your account and message data are retained while your account remains active.
  • Upon account deletion, we take reasonable steps to delete or anonymize your data, subject to any legal retention obligations.
  • Sent or expired messages may be retained temporarily for audit or support reasons, then securely purged.

7. Your Data Rights

You have the right to access, update, or delete your personal information. You can do this by:

  • Editing your profile or message settings within your account dashboard.
  • Contacting us to request access, correction, or deletion of your data.

We will respond to all data requests within a reasonable timeframe, in accordance with applicable laws.

8. Children's Privacy

The Service is not intended for use by individuals under the age of 13 (or a higher age threshold if required by local law). We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If we become aware that a child has provided personal data, we will delete it immediately.

9. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may revise this Privacy Policy from time to time. When we do, we will update the "Last Updated" date and notify users of material changes via email or platform notification. Continued use of the Service after changes implies acceptance of the updated Policy.

10. Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or how we handle your data, please contact us at: support@cronpost.com

faqs_page.title: Tips & Help - CronPost
faqs_page.hero_p: Find answers and tips to make the most of CronPost.
faqs_page.answer_01:
CronPost is a digital contingency planning service, designed to help you send important messages and deliver love to your relatives, even when you can't be present. It is a secure network that allows you to schedule messages (via email or in-app messages) to be sent automatically, ensuring your messages always reach the right person at the right time, in any situation.

CronPost offers two main functions to meet different user needs:

1. Ultimate Cron Messenger (UCM) - The Digital "Dead Man's Switch"

This is the core feature, acting as a "dead man's switch" for your digital life. Here’s how it works:

  • You set up a "check-in" schedule (e.g., weekly, monthly) to confirm to the system that you are still safe and active.
  • If you miss this check-in after reminders, the system will automatically activate and send out the important messages (called Initial Message - IM and Follow-up Messages - FMs) that you have prepared in advance.

This is the ideal solution to:

  • Protect your digital legacy: Ensure access information for digital assets like bank accounts, e-wallets, and important documents is sent securely to your loved ones.
  • Send a final message: Convey your thoughts, feelings, and instructions to family and friends, ensuring your voice is still heard.
  • Ensure personal safety: Activate automatic alerts for those working in high-risk environments such as journalists, soldiers, and aid workers.

2. Simple Cron Messenger (SCM) - Direct Timed-Message Sending

This is a simple and direct tool for when you just want to send a message at a specific future time without a complex check-in mechanism. SCM is perfect for:

  • Sending birthday and anniversary greetings on the exact day, even if you plan years in advance.
  • Setting reminders for yourself or others about important events.
  • Sending scheduled announcements conveniently and accurately.

In summary, CronPost is more than just a timed messaging tool. It is a dedicated assistant and a protective shield, helping you prepare for life's uncertainties and ensuring your most important messages are always delivered.
faqs_page.question_02: What sending methods does CronPost support?
faqs_page.answer_02:
CronPost offers you three flexible messaging methods; you can choose the one that best suits your needs for each message you create:

  • CronPost Email (Default): This is the simplest and fastest way to get started. Your message will be sent from our official email address (noreply@cronpost.com). You don't need to perform any technical setup—just compose your message and schedule it.
  • In-App Messaging: Send a secure and direct message to another CronPost user right on our platform. This is a great option for secure communication, as the recipient must also have a CronPost account to view the message. Premium users can send attachments as secure links to Free users.
  • User Email (via your own SMTP): This advanced option allows you to send emails directly from your personal email address, helping recipients recognize you immediately. To do this, you need to perform a one-time setup by providing CronPost with the SMTP information from your email provider.

Information you will need:

  • SMTP Server (e.g., smtp.gmail.com)
  • Port (e.g., 587 or 465)
  • Email and App Password

Important Note: For security reasons, most major email providers (like Google, Microsoft, Yahoo) require you to create a separate App Password to use with third-party services like CronPost, instead of using your main login password.

How to find the information and create an App Password: You can refer to the official guides from popular providers or search on Google/ask an AI with the syntax "SMTP settings [Your email provider's name]" and "Create App Password [Your email provider's name]".
faqs_page.answer_03:
Simple Cron Messenger (SCM) is the tool that allows you to send a message at a specific future time without the UCM's "check-in" mechanism. It is the perfect choice for sending birthday wishes, event reminders, or any other announcements you want to schedule in advance.

Scheduling an SCM message is very simple. After composing the content, you will have two main scheduling options:

1. Schedule a One-Time Send (Unloop SCM)

This option is used to send your message only once at a precise date and time in the future.

How to set up:

  • On the scheduling screen, select the "One-time Schedule" option.
  • Use the displayed calendar and clock to select the exact date and time you want the message to be sent.
  • Press "Start SCM", and your message will be queued to be sent at the specified time.

2. Schedule a Recurring Send (Loop SCM)

This option allows you to send the same message multiple times according to a cycle you define.

How to set up:

  • Select the "Loop Schedule" option.
  • Choose the "Loop Type" you want, including:
    • By minutes: Send repeatedly after a certain number of minutes.
    • By days: Send repeatedly after a certain number of days at a specific time.
    • Day of the week: Send on a fixed day of the week (e.g., 9:00 AM every Monday).
    • Date of the month: Send on a fixed date each month (e.g., the 15th of every month).
    • Date of the year: Send on a fixed date each year (e.g., December 25th every year).
  • Fill in the corresponding parameters for your chosen loop type (e.g., number of minutes, days, or sending time).
  • Finally, in the "Repeat" section, enter the total number of times you want the message to be sent.
  • Once you are satisfied with the setup, just press "Start SCM", and the system will automatically manage the sending for you according to the set schedule.
faqs_page.answer_04:
Ultimate Cron Messenger (UCM) is the heart of CronPost. You can think of it as an automated guardian that operates based on your account's status. Understanding these statuses will help you master the service completely.

The UCM lifecycle revolves around these 4 main statuses:

1. INS (Inactive Status)

This is the initial and "resting" state of your account. In this state, the UCM system is not activated, no countdown is running, and no messages are scheduled to be sent. The system is waiting for you to set up a schedule (by creating and activating an IM) to begin.

2. ANS (Active Status)

When you have activated a schedule, the account switches to this state. This is the "normal" and safe state, which consists of two alternating phases:

  • CLC (Check-in Loop Countdown): This is the "safe" period and makes up the majority of the active cycle. A clock will count down to the time you need to check-in. During this phase, the system defaults to considering you as safely checked-in.
  • WCT (Waiting Check-in Time): When the CLC timer ends, the Waiting Check-in Time (WCT) window opens. This is a limited period (set by you, e.g., 6 hours) during which you must perform the "check-in" action to inform the system you are still safe. If you do not check-in before this window closes, the next state will be triggered.

3. FNS (Frozen and Send Status)

This is the most critical backup state, automatically triggered when you fail to check-in within the WCT window. When in the FNS state:

  • The account is frozen: You cannot change any settings, messages, or schedules to ensure the integrity of the plan.
  • The system begins sending messages: Your scheduled messages will start being sent in the predefined order.
  • A special action is required to stop: To exit this state, you need to use a special link sent to your email or take action from within your account.

Understanding this INS → ANS (CLC and WCT) → FNS cycle will give you peace of mind that your important messages will always be sent exactly when you need them most.
faqs_page.question_05: What is an IM and how does it work?
faqs_page.answer_05:
The Initial Message (IM) is the first and most important message in the Ultimate Cron Messenger (UCM) process. You can think of it as the "cornerstone" of your contingency plan.

The main roles of an IM are:

  • Activate UCM: Creating and scheduling an IM will switch your account from inactive (INS) to active (ANS), starting the safety monitoring cycle.
  • Define the Check-in Schedule: The schedule you set for the IM determines your "check-in" cycle, including both the Countdown Loop (CLC) and the Waiting Check-in Time (WCT).
  • Be the First Message Sent: If the emergency FNS state is triggered (because you didn't check-in), the IM will be the first message automatically sent by the system to your recipient.

How to Schedule an IM?

You have two main scheduling options for an IM, depending on whether you need continuous monitoring or just for a specific future event.

1. Recurring Schedule (Loop Check-in)

This option is suitable when you want a continuously repeating check-in cycle for safety monitoring. You can choose the following loop types:

  • Daily: The system will require you to check-in at a fixed time every day.
  • By a Specific Number of Days: Check-in repeats after a certain period, such as every 3 days.
  • By Day of the Week: Check-in on a fixed day of the week (e.g., 9:00 AM every Monday).
  • By Date of the Month: Check-in on a fixed date each month (e.g., the 15th of every month).
  • By Date of the Year: Check-in on a fixed date each year (e.g., December 25th every year).

2. One-Time Schedule (Unloop Check-in)

This option is used when you only want UCM to monitor for a single, specific time in the future. You will choose a precise date and time for the message to be sent if you do not check-in.

Critical Warning for One-Time Schedules: If you set your Initial Message (IM) to use a "One-time Schedule", please be aware that any check-in action will permanently cancel this schedule. You will need to set it up again. To avoid accidental cancellation, consider disabling the "Automatic on Sign-in" feature if you use this type of schedule.
faqs_page.question_06: What is an FM and how does it work?
faqs_page.answer_06:
A Follow-up Message (FM) is an additional message sent after your Initial Message (IM), in the event your account enters the FNS (Frozen and Send) emergency state.

You can create multiple FMs to send a sequence of information over time. For example, your IM could be a general notification, then an FM is sent 3 days later to provide detailed instructions, and another FM is sent the following week with additional information.

Important Note: You must create and schedule an Initial Message (IM) before you can create a Follow-up Message (FM).

How to Schedule an FM?

The key difference when scheduling an FM is that its timing is always calculated relative to the start of the FNS state (i.e., when the IM is sent). You have the following flexible scheduling options:

  • Number of days after IM is sent: Send the FM a specific number of days after FNS begins. For example, if you set it to "3 days", the message will be sent on the 3rd day of the FNS process.
    • Special note for the value "0 days":
    • If you set the value to "0 days", the FM will be scheduled to be sent on the same day that FNS begins.
    • However, the sending will only occur if the time you set for the FM (e.g., 15:00) is later than the actual time the IM was sent on that day (e.g., 10:00).
    • In the opposite case (e.g., you set the FM to be sent at 18:00, but FNS only starts at 19:00), that FM message will be considered undeliverable and will be moved to the "cancelled" state.
    • You cannot set a repeat for an FM scheduled for "0 days" after the IM.
  • A day of the week: Send the FM on the next specific day of the week. For example, if FNS starts on a Thursday, you can schedule a message to be sent the following "Monday".
  • A date of the month: Send the FM on a specific day of the next month. For example, send on the "15th" of the month after FNS starts.
  • A date of the year: Send the FM on a specific day and month annually. For example, send on "December 25th" every year after FNS starts.
  • A specific date (Non-recurring): Send the FM once on a specific future date, month, and year, as long as that time is after the IM has been sent.
faqs_page.question_07: How can I perform a Check-in?
faqs_page.answer_07:
Checking in is the core action to reset the UCM countdown and prevent the emergency sending process (FNS). When your account is in the WCT (Waiting Check-in Time) state, you can do this in the following ways:

1. Manual Check-in Button on the Website:

This is the main and most direct method. A large "CHECK-IN" button will be activated and prominently displayed in two places:

  • On your Dashboard.
  • On the Ultimate Cron Messenger (UCM) page. You just need to press this button to complete the check-in.

2. Automatic on Sign-in (Optional):

This is a convenient feature that you can enable on the Profile & Settings page (user-profile.html).

  • How it works: If enabled, simply logging into your account during the WCT period will automatically be recorded as a check-in.
  • Note on PIN code: If you also enable the "Require PIN for all critical actions" option, a window will pop up after you log in, asking you to enter your PIN to confirm this check-in action. If you do not enter the PIN, the check-in will not be counted.

3. Check-in Link via Email (Optional):

For maximum convenience, you can enable the "Add a one-click check-in link..." option in the Check-in Options section of your profile.

  • How it works: When this feature is enabled, the WCT reminder emails that the system sends you will contain a special, secure link.
  • You just need to click this link to perform the check-in immediately without needing to log in or enter a PIN.
  • Important note: For security reasons, each check-in token included in reminder emails is only valid until a new reminder email (with a new check-in token) is sent. The maximum validity period of any check-in token is until the end of the current WCT cycle.
  • Security Note: Because this method bypasses the usual authentication steps, it offers high convenience but reduces a layer of security. Please consider carefully before enabling this feature.

4. Additional Check-in Reminder (Premium Feature):

This is a special feature for Premium users to enhance peace of mind.

  • How it works: In addition to the default reminder emails, you can set up one final additional reminder to be sent to your email.
  • Customization: You can customize when this reminder is sent by setting a specific number of minutes before your WCT window closes, giving you one last chance to check-in and mitigate potential risks.
faqs_page.question_08: What are some tips and suggestions for setting up a suitable UCM?
faqs_page.answer_08:
To set up an effective and reliable UCM plan, you should consider the special cases for schedules and apply some suggestions for appropriate frequency.

a. Important Notes on Scheduling

Our system is designed to handle special time cases intelligently, but you need to know how it works:

  • "One-time" Schedule for IM: This is the most important note. If you set your Initial Message (IM) to a "one-time" schedule (e.g., to be sent on 01/01/2026), any check-in action you take before that time will permanently cancel this schedule. To avoid unintentional cancellation, you should consider disabling the "Automatically check-in on login" option.
  • Non-existent dates in a month: If you set a recurring schedule for the 31st of every month, the system will automatically skip sending in months that do not have a 31st day (like February, April, June...). Your check-in cycle will continue and wait for the next valid month (e.g., May).
  • February 29th: Similarly, if your schedule falls on February 29th, the system will skip it in non-leap years and continue its normal cycle.
  • FM set to "0 days after IM": This message will be sent on the same day FNS begins, but only if its scheduled sending time is later than the actual time the IM was sent. If FNS starts at 7:00 PM, an FM scheduled for 6:00 PM will be canceled because its valid sending time has passed.
  • FM with a one-time (Unloop) schedule: This schedule will only be executed if its sending time is after FNS has started. If your FNS starts after the date you set for the FM, that message will be skipped.

b. Suggestions for an Effective UCM Setup

  • Start with IM, then FMs: Always set up and schedule your Initial Message (IM) first. This will activate the check-in cycle. Only then should you create your Follow-up Messages (FMs).
  • Choose a suitable CLC (Check-in Loop) frequency:
    • Unless you have a special purpose (like being in a high-risk area), you should not set the check-in frequency too short (e.g., daily). This can be annoying and easily lead to missed check-ins due to being busy.
    • An ideal frequency is to choose a special day annually (e.g., your birthday, New Year's Day). This turns checking in into a meaningful, memorable, and low-pressure habit.
  • Set a reasonable WCT (Waiting Check-in Time):
    • Don't set it too short: A very short WCT (e.g., 1-2 hours) can be easily missed if you are in a meeting or experience a temporary issue (lost phone, no internet).
    • Don't set it too long: A very long WCT (e.g., several days) might lead to complacency, where you read the reminder email and then forget about it.
    • Suggestion: A period of 24 to 72 hours is usually most suitable. It's long enough for you to handle temporary issues but short enough to act on right after receiving the reminder email.
  • Don't forget important anniversaries: Take advantage of the "Date of the year" scheduling feature for FMs to prepare loving messages for special occasions like your children's birthdays or your wedding anniversary. This way, even if FNS is activated, the system will remember and automatically send these messages to your loved ones on that special day each year. It's a wonderful way to ensure your care is always present, creating meaningful "hugs that transcend time."
  • Use the "Trust Verifier Email": This is a very important layer of protection. Add the email of a trusted person (spouse, best friend...). If FNS is activated, they will also receive a notification email and can help you stop the process if it's a false alarm.
faqs_page.question_09: How to stop an activated FNS (Frozen and Send) process?
faqs_page.answer_09:
When your account enters the FNS state, you still have full control to stop it. CronPost provides two main methods for you to do this, ensuring safety even if you cannot log in to your account.

1. Stop FNS via Email Link (Token Method)

This is the most flexible method, designed for emergencies when you may not have access to your CronPost account.

  • How it works: As soon as FNS begins, the system automatically sends an email containing a unique, secure termination link to your email address. If you have set up a "Trust Verifier Email", that person will also receive a similar email.
  • Process:
    1. Open the email and click the FNS termination link.
    2. You will be redirected to a special confirmation page. This page does not require a login or PIN.
    3. Press the [Confirm FNS Termination] button to complete the process.
  • Important time limit: For security reasons, the FNS Termination Link sent to your email is only valid for 72 hours after the FNS process begins.

2. Stop FNS directly from the UCM Page (In-app)

If you can still log in to your CronPost account, this is the most direct and secure way, especially after the email link has expired.

  • How it works: When the account is in the FNS state, the Ultimate Cron Messenger (UCM) page will display a special interface.
  • Process:
    1. Log in to your CronPost account.
    2. Go to the UCM page (or click the [STOP FNS] button on the Dashboard).
    3. On this page, you will see a large [TERMINATE] button.
    4. Click this button. If you have a PIN set, the system will ask you to enter it to authenticate the action, which is an important security step.
  • Benefit: This method allows you to stop FNS at any time as long as you can log in, without being limited by the 72-hour validity of the token.

After you confirm the FNS termination using one of these two methods, all unsent messages (IM and FMs) will be canceled, and your account will return to the INS (Inactive) state, ready for you to set up again if you wish.

faqs_page.question_11: What are the message-related limits to be aware of?
faqs_page.answer_11:
To ensure the system operates stably and fairly for all users, CronPost has some limits on messages, which differ between Free and Premium accounts. Here are the main limits you need to be aware of:

1. Message Length Limit

Each message you compose (including UCM and SCM) has a maximum character limit in the content section:

  • Free Account: 5,000 characters/message.
  • Premium Account: 50,000 characters/message.

2. Stored Messages Limit

This is the total number of messages (including UCM, SCM, and unscheduled drafts) that you are allowed to store in your account at one time.

  • Free Account: 100 messages.
  • Premium Account: 10,000 messages.

3. Active Messages Limit

This is a more critical limit that only counts messages with a pending and valid schedule. Messages that are in draft form or have completed sending are not counted toward this limit.

  • Free Account: 10 active messages.
  • Premium Account: 1,000 active messages.

How recurring active messages are counted: A special point to note is how the system counts this limit for recurring messages. A message set to repeat will consume a number of slots in the "Active Messages" limit corresponding to its remaining number of repetitions.

Example: If you create an FM and set it to repeat 5 times, it will occupy 5 slots in your active message limit. After the message is sent for the first time, it will only occupy 4 slots, and so on until it is completed.

4. In-App Messaging Storage Time Limit

To ensure system performance, messages in the In-App Messaging (IAM) feature will be automatically cleaned up after a certain period. This limit does not apply to your UCM and SCM messages.

  • Free Account: Messages are stored for 60 days.
  • Premium Account: Messages are stored for 360 days.

Note: In a conversation between a Free and a Premium user, the longer storage time of 360 days will be applied.
faqs_page.question_12: How can I be sure that my messages will be sent as configured?
faqs_page.answer_12:
We understand that reliability is the most crucial element of our service. CronPost ensures the delivery of your messages through three main mechanisms: visual monitoring, automatic retries, and careful user guidance.

1. Real-Time Visual Monitoring

You can always see exactly what the system is doing:

  • Countdown Timers: Both the UCM and SCM pages have continuously running countdown timers, showing the exact time remaining until the next action (the next check-in or the message sending time). This helps you always stay aware of the status of your schedules.
  • Sending History Page: This is where you can check and verify every message that has been sent. This page records details of each send, including:
    • Which message was sent.
    • Who the recipient was.
    • The exact time of sending.
    • The final status: Success, Failed, or Partially successful.

2. Automatic Retry Mechanism

Sometimes, sending an email can encounter temporary issues (e.g., the recipient's server is down). To handle this, CronPost has a smart automatic retry mechanism:

  • If a message (SCM or FM) cannot be sent on the first attempt, the system will not give up immediately. Instead, it will automatically try to resend that message up to 3 times with increasing intervals between each attempt.
  • Only after all 3 attempts have failed will the message be marked as "Failed" in the Sending History.

Special Note for Initial Messages (IM): Due to its urgent nature and as the initiating message, the IM will only be sent once and does not have an automatic retry mechanism. However, even if sending the IM fails (e.g., due to an incorrect recipient email address), the FNS process will still continue. The Follow-up Messages (FMs) in your sending flow will still be processed and sent according to their set schedule.

3. Important Tips to Ensure Successful Sending

To help the system operate as accurately as possible, please note the following points:

  • Check Your Timezone: All schedules you set will operate based on the timezone you have configured in your CronPost Profile, not the timezone on your computer or phone. Please ensure you have selected the correct timezone.
  • Check Recipient Addresses: A small typo in an email address can cause the sending to fail. Always double-check the recipient's address before saving the message.
  • Note on Attachment Size:
    • When using the CronPost Email method (for Premium accounts), you can attach files with a total size of less than 49 MB.
    • If you use your own SMTP (e.g., Gmail, Outlook), you will be limited by the provider's size limit, which is typically around 25 MB. Please check your email provider's limit to ensure attachments are not too large.
faqs_page.question_13: What is a Quote and how does it work?
faqs_page.answer_13:
The Quote feature allows you to automatically insert randomly selected, pre-saved quotes into your messages. This helps make your messages more lively and meaningful. You can use quote collections created by CronPost or create and share your own.

How to Use

1. Manage Quote Collections (Folders)

First, you need to access the Quote Management page from the navigation bar. Here, you can:

  • Create a New Folder: Each folder represents a theme (e.g., 'love-quotes', 'life-philosophy.en'). You can set a description and choose to share it publicly (is_public) for others to use.
  • Add Content: Inside each folder, you can add many different quotes. Each account can create a maximum of 1000 quotes.
  • Discover & Add: You can search for and "add" public folders shared by other users to your collection.

2. Insert a Quote into a Message

When composing a message (UCM, SCM, or IAM), there are two ways to insert a quote:

  • Use the Insert Quote Button: On the editor's toolbar, click the paper icon ('Insert Quote') at the end of the toolbar. A "Quote Picker" window will appear, allowing you to select a folder from the list (system, yours, or subscribed). The system will automatically insert the corresponding placeholder at the cursor's position.
  • Manual Insertion: You can type the placeholder directly into the title or body of the message using the following structure: {{quote:'author','folder_key'}}.
    • author: The creator of the folder. Use 'CronPost' for system folders, or your email for folders you create.
    • folder_key: The identifier of the folder you want to use.

Important Notes

  • Randomness: The system will select one random quote from the folder you specify to insert into the message at the time of sending.
  • Limits: Each account (regardless of Free or Premium) can only create a maximum of 50 Quote Folders and 1,000 Quote Contents.
  • Consistency:
    • If you insert two identical placeholders (in other words, from the same quote folder) in the same message, both will be replaced by the same randomly selected quote.
    • If a message is sent to multiple recipients, they will all receive the version of the message with the same quote.
  • Sharing Quote Folders: You can share folders you create with everyone by setting them to Public. Therefore, be careful not to include sensitive or important information in public Quote Folders.
  • Using Public Quote Folders: You can use Public Quote Folders from other users, but be aware that the content of that Public Quote Folder is decided by its owner. Therefore, to ensure the safety of your message content, we encourage you to only use Quote Folders from CronPost, those you create yourself, or from a source you truly trust.
faqs_page.question_14: Is my data safe and secure?
faqs_page.answer_14:
Yes, safety and security are our top priorities. We understand that you entrust CronPost with sensitive information, so we have built our system with multiple strict layers of protection to ensure your data is always kept absolutely secure.

Technical Measures We Apply

  • Data Encryption and Hashing: We never store your sensitive information in plain text.
    • Passwords, PINs, Recovery Codes: All are hashed using strong cryptographic algorithms (bcrypt) before being saved to the database. This means that even we cannot read your password or PIN.
    • SMTP Passwords: The app password you provide for sending emails via your own SMTP will be securely encrypted before being stored.
  • End-to-End Encryption: All your data is encrypted both in transit (between your browser and our servers, using SSL/TLS) and at rest.
  • Protection Against Attacks:
    • Rate Limiting: The system automatically limits the number of login or password reset requests to protect against automated (brute-force) attacks.
    • PIN Lockout: If someone enters your PIN incorrectly too many times, the account will be temporarily locked to prevent malicious attempts.
    • CAPTCHA Verification: We use technologies like Cloudflare Turnstile on login and registration pages to block malicious bots.
  • Secure Infrastructure and Privacy Policy:
    • Top-Tier Providers: Your data is stored on the infrastructure of world-leading cloud service providers, with the highest security and reliability standards.
    • Backup Schedule: We have a strict and automated data backup schedule to ensure your data is not lost.
    • No Privacy Invasion: We are committed to never reading, sharing, or selling the content of your private messages. Only the automated system will process the sending of messages according to the schedule you have set.

Tips to Enhance Security

To ensure absolute security for your most critical data (such as bank account information, crypto wallet keys, trading accounts, etc.), CronPost recommends you follow this method:

Store this extremely sensitive data in a safe offline place you trust (e.g., in a safe, an encrypted USB, or a reputable password manager). Then, use CronPost to send messages containing detailed instructions to your loved ones on how to access and use that important data. This way, the original information never appears online.

Important Legal Notice: Warning: CronPost is a technology platform, not a legal, financial, or inheritance/will service. We are not legally responsible if the recipient does not receive the message due to factors beyond our control (e.g., incorrect email address, email going to spam...). Users are responsible for consulting the laws of their country regarding matters related to wills and inheritance to ensure their plans are legally valid.
faqs_page.question_15: What does the Premium package unlock?
faqs_page.answer_15:
CronPost's Free plan provides all the core features, but the Premium package is designed to give you more storage, flexibility, and advanced tools. When you upgrade, you will unlock the following key benefits:

  • Send Attachments and Unlock Storage: Premium users can upload and store important files (up to 2 GB) and attach them to any message (UCM, SCM, and IAM). The email size limit is also increased to under 49MB (compared to text-only on the Free plan).
  • Increased Message and Recipient Limits: The Premium plan offers significantly higher limits, allowing you to plan more comprehensively:
    • Active Messages: Increased from 10 to 1,000 messages.
    • Stored Messages: Increased from 100 to 10,000 messages.
    • Message Length: Increased from 5,000 to 50,000 characters.
    • Number of Recipients: The number of recipients for each message is also significantly increased across all sending methods.
  • Advanced Check-in Options: You will have more tools to control your UCM process, including the feature to set up a final additional check-in reminder before the WCT window closes, giving you an extra chance to confirm your safety.

For a detailed comparison of all features, please visit our Pricing page.

Important Note on Fairness: CronPost is committed to non-discrimination. All messages (whether from Free or Premium accounts) have the same processing priority in our system. The Premium package only unlocks additional features and higher limits to serve your advanced needs.
